summary.long: Exodus is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt (every man and his household came with Jacob):
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: and Joseph was in Egypt already.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who knew not Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: come, let us deal wisely with them, lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they also join themselves unto our enemies, and fight against us, and get them up out of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh store-cities, Pithom and Raamses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and the more they spread abroad. And they were grieved because of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigor:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they made their lives bitter with hard service, in mortar and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field, all their service, wherein they made them serve with rigor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Egypt spake to the Hebrew midwives, of whom the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them upon the birth-stool; if it be a son, then ye shall kill him; but if it be a daughter, then she shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the men-children alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said unto them, Why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men-children alive?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwife come unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God dealt well with the midwives: and the people multiplied, and waxed very mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that he made them households.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there went a man of the house of Levi, and took to wife a daughter of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the woman conceived, and bare a son: and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch; and she put the child therein, and laid it in the flags by the river’s brink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe at the river; and her maidens walked along by the river-side; and she saw the ark among the flags, and sent her handmaid to fetch it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she opened it, and saw the child: and, behold, the babe wept. And she had compassion on him, and said, This is one of the Hebrews’ children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said his sister to Pharaoh’s daughter, Shall I go and call thee a nurse of the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, Go. And the maiden went and called the child’s mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh’s daughter said unto her, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child, and nursed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew, and she brought him unto Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses, and said, Because I drew him out of the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown up, that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens: and he saw an Egyptian smiting a Hebrew, one of his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he smote the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out the second day, and, behold, two men of the Hebrews were striving together: and he said to him that did the wrong, Wherefore smitest thou thy fellow?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us? thinkest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian? And Moses feared, and said, Surely the thing is known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian: and he sat down by a well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters: and they came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the shepherds came and drove them away; but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to Reuel their father, he said, How is it that ye are come so soon to-day?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and moreover he drew water for us, and watered the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto his daughters, And where is he? why is it that ye have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she bare a son, and he called his name Gershom; for he said, I have been a sojourner in a foreign land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in the course of those many days, that the king of Egypt died: and the children of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto God by reason of the bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God saw the children of Israel, and God took knowledge of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses was keeping the flock of Jethro his father-in-law, the priest of Midian: and he led the flock to the back of the wilderness, and came to the mountain of God, unto Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of Jehovah appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush: and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, I will turn aside now, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jehovah saw that he turned aside to see, God called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moses, Moses. And he said, Here am I.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And he said, Draw not nigh hither: put off thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Moreover he said, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. And Moses hid his face; for he was afraid to look upon God.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Jehovah said, I have surely seen the affliction of my people that are in Egypt, and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters; for I know their sorrows;
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and I am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up out of that land unto a good land and a large, unto a land flowing with milk and honey; unto the place of the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And now, behold, the cry of the children of Israel is come unto me: moreover I have seen the oppression wherewith the Egyptians oppress them.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Come now therefore, and I will send thee unto Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring forth my people the children of Israel out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Moses said unto God, Who am I, that I should go unto Pharaoh, and that I should bring forth the children of Israel out of Egypt?
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And he said, Certainly I will be with thee; and this shall be the token unto thee, that I have sent thee: when thou hast brought forth the people out of Egypt, ye shall serve God upon this mountain.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Moses said unto God, Behold, when I come unto the children of Israel, and shall say unto them, The God of your fathers hath sent me unto you; and they shall say to me, What is his name? What shall I say unto them?
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God said unto Moses, I am that I am: and he said, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, I am hath sent me unto you.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God said moreover unto Moses, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, Jehovah, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath sent me unto you: this is my name for ever, and this is my memorial unto all generations.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Go, and gather the elders of Israel together, and say unto them, Jehovah, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, hath appeared unto me, saying, I have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in Egypt:
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and I have said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt unto the land of the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, unto a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And they shall hearken to thy voice: and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye shall say unto him, Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, hath met with us: and now let us go, we pray thee, three days’ journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to Jehovah our God.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And I know that the king of Egypt will not give you leave to go, no, not by a mighty hand.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And I will put forth my hand, and smite Egypt with all my wonders which I will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will let you go.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And I will give this people favor in the sight of the Egyptians: and it shall come to pass, that, when ye go, ye shall not go empty:
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: but every woman shall ask of her neighbor, and of her that sojourneth in her house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment: and ye shall put them upon your sons, and upon your daughters; and ye shall despoil the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Moses answered and said, But, behold, they will not believe me, nor hearken unto my voice; for they will say, Jehovah hath not appeared unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto him, What is that in thy hand? And he said, A rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Cast it on the ground. And he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent; and Moses fled from before it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Put forth thy hand, and take it by the tail (and he put forth his hand, and laid hold of it, and it became a rod in his hand);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they may believe that Jehovah, the God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath appeared unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said furthermore unto him, Put now thy hand into thy bosom. And he put his hand into his bosom: and when he took it out, behold, his hand was leprous, as white as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Put thy hand into thy bosom again. (And he put his hand into his bosom again; and when he took it out of his bosom, behold, it was turned again as his other flesh.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe thee, neither hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe even these two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, that thou shalt take of the water of the river, and pour it upon the dry land: and the water which thou takest out of the river shall become blood upon the dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Jehovah, Oh, Lord, I am not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast spoken unto thy servant; for I am slow of speech, and of a slow tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto him, Who hath made man’s mouth? Or who maketh a man dumb, or deaf, or seeing, or blind? is it not I, Jehovah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore go, and I will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou shalt speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Oh, Lord, send, I pray thee, by the hand of him whom thou wilt send.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Moses, and he said, Is there not Aaron thy brother the Levite? I know that he can speak well. And also, behold, he cometh forth to meet thee: and when he seeth thee, he will be glad in his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt speak unto him, and put the words in his mouth: and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye shall do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall be thy spokesman unto the people; and it shall come to pass, that he shall be to thee a mouth, and thou shalt be to him as God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take in thy hand this rod, wherewith thou shalt do the signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses went and returned to Jethro his father-in-law, and said unto him, Let me go, I pray thee, and return unto my brethren that are in Egypt, and see whether they be yet alive. And Jethro said to Moses, Go in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses in Midian, Go, return into Egypt; for all the men are dead that sought thy life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took his wife and his sons, and set them upon an ass, and he returned to the land of Egypt: and Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, When thou goest back into Egypt, see that thou do before Pharaoh all the wonders which I have put in thy hand: but I will harden his heart, and he will not let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt say unto Pharaoh, Thus saith Jehovah, Israel is my son, my first-born:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have said unto thee, Let my son go, that he may serve me; and thou hast refused to let him go: behold, I will slay thy son, thy first-born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the way at the lodging-place, that Jehovah met him, and sought to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zipporah took a flint, and cut off the foreskin of her son, and cast it at his feet; and she said, Surely a bridegroom of blood art thou to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he let him alone. Then she said, A bridegroom of blood art thou, because of the circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said to Aaron, Go into the wilderness to meet Moses. And he went, and met him in the mountain of God, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses told Aaron all the words of Jehovah wherewith he had sent him, and all the signs wherewith he had charged him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron spake all the words which Jehovah had spoken unto Moses, and did the signs in the sight of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people believed: and when they heard that Jehovah had visited the children of Israel, and that he had seen their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward Moses and Aaron came, and said unto Pharaoh, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may hold a feast unto me in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said, Who is Jehovah, that I should hearken unto his voice to let Israel go? I know not Jehovah, and moreover I will not let Israel go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days’ journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice unto Jehovah our God, lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Egypt said unto them, Wherefore do ye, Moses and Aaron, loose the people from their works? get you unto your burdens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said, Behold, the people of the land are now many, and ye make them rest from their burdens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the same day Pharaoh commanded the taskmasters of the people, and their officers, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall no more give the people straw to make brick, as heretofore: let them go and gather straw for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the number of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish aught thereof: for they are idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let heavier work be laid upon the men, that they may labor therein; and let them not regard lying words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the taskmasters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spake to the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will not give you straw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go yourselves, get you straw where ye can find it; for nought of your work shall be diminished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the taskmasters were urgent, saying, Fulfil your works, your daily tasks, as when there was straw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the officers of the children of Israel, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, Wherefore have ye not fulfilled your task both yesterday and to-day, in making brick as heretofore?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried unto Pharaoh, saying, Wherefore dealest thou thus with thy servants?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no straw given unto thy servants, and they say to us, Make brick: and, behold, thy servants are beaten; but the fault is in thine own people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, Ye are idle, ye are idle: therefore ye say, Let us go and sacrifice to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go therefore now, and work; for there shall no straw be given you, yet shall ye deliver the number of bricks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the officers of the children of Israel did see that they were in evil case, when it was said, Ye shall not diminish aught from your bricks, your daily tasks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way, as they came forth from Pharaoh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said unto them, Jehovah look upon you, and judge; because ye have made our savor to be abhorred in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to slay us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses returned unto Jehovah, and said, Lord, wherefore hast thou dealt ill with this people? why is it that thou hast sent me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in thy name, he hath dealt ill with this people; neither hast thou delivered thy people at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Now shalt thou see what I will do to Pharaoh: for by a strong hand shall he let them go, and by a strong hand shall he drive them out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God spake unto Moses, and said unto him, I am Jehovah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, as God Almighty; but by my name Jehovah I was not known to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their sojournings, wherein they sojourned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And moreover I have heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage; and I have remembered my covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore say unto the children of Israel, I am Jehovah, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will rid you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm, and with great judgments:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will take you to me for a people, and I will be to you a God; and ye shall know that I am Jehovah your God, who bringeth you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring you in unto the land which I sware to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; and I will give it you for a heritage: I am Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses spake so unto the children of Israel: but they hearkened not unto Moses for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go in, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses spake before Jehovah, saying, Behold, the children of Israel have not hearkened unto me; how then shall Pharaoh hear me, who am of uncircumcised lips?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, and gave them a charge unto the children of Israel, and unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the heads of their fathers’ houses. The sons of Reuben the first-born of Israel: Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi; these are the families of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Simeon: Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman; these are the families of Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations: Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari; and the years of the life of Levi were a hundred thirty and seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Kohath: Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel; and the years of the life of Kohath were a hundred thirty and three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Amram took him Jochebed his father’s sister to wife; and she bare him Aaron and Moses: and the years of the life of Amram were a hundred and thirty and seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Izhar: Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Uzziel: Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Sithri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron took him Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab, the sister of Nahshon, to wife; and she bare him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Korah: Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the families of the Korahites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar Aaron’s son took him one of the daughters of Putiel to wife; and she bare him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom Jehovah said, Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are they that spake to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt: these are that Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the day when Jehovah spake unto Moses in the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying, I am Jehovah: speak thou unto Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I speak unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said before Jehovah, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken unto me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, See, I have made thee as God to Pharaoh; and Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt speak all that I command thee; and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Pharaoh will not hearken unto you, and I will lay my hand upon Egypt, and bring forth my hosts, my people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians shall know that I am Jehovah, when I stretch forth my hand upon Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron did so; as Jehovah commanded them, so did they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was fourscore years old, and Aaron fourscore and three years old, when they spake unto Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pharaoh shall speak unto you, saying, Show a wonder for you; then thou shalt say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and cast it down before Pharaoh, that it become a serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and they did so, as Jehovah had commanded: and Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh also called for the wise men and the sorcerers: and they also, the magicians of Egypt, did in like manner with their enchantments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they cast down every man his rod, and they became serpents: but Aaron’s rod swallowed up their rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as Jehovah had spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Pharaoh’s heart is stubborn, he refuseth to let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get thee unto Pharaoh in the morning; lo, he goeth out unto the water; and thou shalt stand by the river’s brink to meet him; and the rod which was turned to a serpent shalt thou take in thy hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt say unto him, Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, hath sent me unto thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness: and, behold, hitherto thou hast not hearkened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith Jehovah, In this thou shalt know that I am Jehovah: behold, I will smite with the rod that is in my hand upon the waters which are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fish that are in the river shall die, and the river shall become foul; and the Egyptians shall loathe to drink water from the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and stretch out thy hand over the waters of Egypt, over their rivers, over their streams, and over their pools, and over all their ponds of water, that they may become blood; and there shall be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood and in vessels of stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron did so, as Jehovah commanded; and he lifted up the rod, and smote the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fish that were in the river died; and the river became foul, and the Egyptians could not drink water from the river; and the blood was throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the magicians of Egypt did in like manner with their enchantments: and Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as Jehovah had spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh turned and went into his house, neither did he lay even this to heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the Egyptians digged round about the river for water to drink; for they could not drink of the water of the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seven days were fulfilled, after that Jehovah had smitten the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the river shall swarm with frogs, which shall go up and come into thy house, and into thy bedchamber, and upon thy bed, and into the house of thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thine ovens, and into thy kneading-troughs:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the frogs shall come up both upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon all thy servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch forth thy hand with thy rod over the rivers, over the streams, and over the pools, and cause frogs to come up upon the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt; and the frogs came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the magicians did in like manner with their enchantments, and brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Entreat Jehovah, that he take away the frogs from me, and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may sacrifice unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Pharaoh, Have thou this glory over me: against what time shall I entreat for thee, and for thy servants, and for thy people, that the frogs be destroyed from thee and thy houses, and remain in the river only?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Against to-morrow. And he said, Be it according to thy word; that thou mayest know that there is none like unto Jehovah our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the frogs shall depart from thee, and from thy houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people; they shall remain in the river only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh: and Moses cried unto Jehovah concerning the frogs which he had brought upon Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah did according to the word of Moses; and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the courts, and out of the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gathered them together in heaps; and the land stank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Pharaoh saw that there was respite, he hardened his heart, and hearkened not unto them; as Jehovah had spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch out thy rod, and smite the dust of the earth, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did so; and Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and smote the dust of the earth, and there were lice upon man, and upon beast; all the dust of the earth became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the magicians did so with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not: and there were lice upon man, and upon beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the magicians said unto Pharaoh, This is the finger of God: and Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as Jehovah had spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh; lo, he cometh forth to the water; and say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Else, if thou wilt not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies upon thee, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thy houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground whereon they are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will set apart in that day the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there; to the end thou mayest know that I am Jehovah in the midst of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will put a division between my people and thy people: by to-morrow shall this sign be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah did so; and there came grievous swarms of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants’ houses: and in all the land of Egypt the land was corrupted by reason of the swarms of flies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron, and said, Go ye, sacrifice to your God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, It is not meet so to do; for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to Jehovah our God: lo, shall we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, and will they not stone us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will go three days’ journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to Jehovah our God, as he shall command us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to Jehovah your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Behold, I go out from thee, and I will entreat Jehovah that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, to-morrow: only let not Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses went out from Pharaoh, and entreated Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah did according to the word of Moses; and he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people; there remained not one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh hardened his heart this time also, and he did not let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehovah said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if thou refuse to let them go, and wilt hold them still,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, the hand of Jehovah is upon thy cattle which are in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the herds, and upon the flocks: there shall be a very grievous murrain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah shall make a distinction between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt; and there shall nothing die of all that belongeth to the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah appointed a set time, saying, To-morrow Jehovah shall do this thing in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah did that thing on the morrow; and all the cattle of Egypt died; but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not so much as one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. But the heart of Pharaoh was stubborn, and he did not let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses and unto Aaron, Take to you handfuls of ashes of the furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it toward heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with blains upon man and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took ashes of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven; and it became a boil breaking forth with blains upon man and upon beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boils were upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them; as Jehovah had spoken unto Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will this time send all my plagues upon thy heart, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people; that thou mayest know that there is none like me in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now I had put forth my hand, and smitten thee and thy people with pestilence, and thou hadst been cut off from the earth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in very deed for this cause have I made thee to stand, to show thee my power, and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As yet exaltest thou thyself against my people, that thou wilt not let them go?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, to-morrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as hath not been in Egypt since the day it was founded even until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore send, hasten in thy cattle and all that thou hast in the field; for every man and beast that shall be found in the field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that feared the word of Jehovah among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he that regarded not the word of Jehovah left his servants and his cattle in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Stretch forth thy hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man, and upon beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven: and Jehovah sent thunder and hail, and fire ran down unto the earth; and Jehovah rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, very grievous, such as had not been in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and beast; and the hail smote every herb of the field, and brake every tree of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh sent, and called for Moses and Aaron, and said unto them, I have sinned this time: Jehovah is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Entreat Jehovah; for there hath been enough of these mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands unto Jehovah; the thunders shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou mayest know that the earth is Jehovah’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear Jehovah God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the flax and the barley were smitten: for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was in bloom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wheat and the spelt were not smitten: for they were not grown up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread abroad his hands unto Jehovah: and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not let the children of Israel go; as Jehovah had spoken by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh: for I have hardened his heart, and the heart of his servants, that I may show these my signs in the midst of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that thou mayest tell in the ears of thy son, and of thy son’s son, what things I have wrought upon Egypt, and my signs which I have done among them; that ye may know that I am Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and said unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, How long wilt thou refuse to humble thyself before me? let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Else, if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, to-morrow will I bring locusts into thy border:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall cover the face of the earth, so that one shall not be able to see the earth: and they shall eat the residue of that which is escaped, which remaineth unto you from the hail, and shall eat every tree which groweth for you out of the field:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thy houses shall be filled, and the houses of all thy servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians; as neither thy fathers nor thy fathers’ fathers have seen, since the day that they were upon the earth unto this day. And he turned, and went out from Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh’s servants said unto him, How long shall this man be a snare unto us? let the men go, that they may serve Jehovah their God: knowest thou not yet that Egypt is destroyed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron were brought again unto Pharaoh: and he said unto them, Go, serve Jehovah your God; but who are they that shall go?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, We will go with our young and with our old; with our sons and with our daughters, with our flocks and with our herds will we go; for we must hold a feast unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, So be Jehovah with you, as I will let you go, and your little ones: look to it; for evil is before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve Jehovah; for that is what ye desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Stretch out thy hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come up upon the land of Egypt, and eat every herb of the land, even all that the hail hath left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt, and Jehovah brought an east wind upon the land all that day, and all the night; and when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt, and rested in all the borders of Egypt; very grievous were they; before them there were no such locusts as they, neither after them shall be such.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened; and they did eat every herb of the land, and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left: and there remained not any green thing, either tree or herb of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste; and he said, I have sinned against Jehovah your God, and against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore forgive, I pray thee, my sin only this once, and entreat Jehovah your God, that he may take away from me this death only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out from Pharaoh, and entreated Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah turned an exceeding strong west wind, which took up the locusts, and drove them into the Red Sea; there remained not one locust in all the border of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jehovah hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Stretch out thy hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, even darkness which may be felt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven; and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they saw not one another, neither rose any one from his place for three days: but all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh called unto Moses, and said, Go ye, serve Jehovah; only let your flocks and your herds be stayed: let your little ones also go with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Thou must also give into our hand sacrifices and burnt-offerings, that we may sacrifice unto Jehovah our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our cattle also shall go with us; there shall not a hoof be left behind; for thereof must we take to serve Jehovah our God; and we know not with what we must serve Jehovah, until we come thither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jehovah hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said unto him, Get thee from me, take heed to thyself, see my face no more; for in the day thou seest my face thou shalt die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Thou hast spoken well; I will see thy face again no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Yet one plague more will I bring upon Pharaoh, and upon Egypt; afterwards he will let you go hence: when he shall let you go, he shall surely thrust you out hence altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak now in the ears of the people, and let them ask every man of his neighbor, and every woman of her neighbor, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh’s servants, and in the sight of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Thus saith Jehovah, About midnight will I go out into the midst of Egypt:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh that sitteth upon his throne, even unto the first-born of the maid-servant that is behind the mill; and all the first-born of cattle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there hath not been, nor shall be any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But against any of the children of Israel shall not a dog move his tongue, against man or beast: that ye may know how that Jehovah doth make a distinction between the Egyptians and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all these thy servants shall come down unto me, and bow down themselves unto me, saying, Get thee out, and all the people that follow thee: and after that I will go out. And he went out from Pharaoh in hot anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Pharaoh will not hearken unto you; that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh: and Jehovah hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This month shall be unto you the beginning of months: it shall be the first month of the year to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak ye unto all the congregation of Israel, saying, In the tenth day of this month they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to their fathers’ houses, a lamb for a household:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if the household be too little for a lamb, then shall he and his neighbor next unto his house take one according to the number of the souls; according to every man’s eating ye shall make your count for the lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male a year old: ye shall take it from the sheep, or from the goats:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye shall keep it until the fourteenth day of the same month; and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it at even.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall take of the blood, and put it on the two side-posts and on the lintel, upon the houses wherein they shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall eat the flesh in that night, roast with fire, and unleavened bread; with bitter herbs they shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat not of it raw, nor boiled at all with water, but roast with fire; its head with its legs and with the inwards thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall let nothing of it remain until the morning; but that which remaineth of it until the morning ye shall burn with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus shall ye eat it: with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste: it is Jehovah’s passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will go through the land of Egypt in that night, and will smite all the first-born in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgments: I am Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the blood shall be to you for a token upon the houses where ye are: and when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and there shall no plague be upon you to destroy you, when I smite the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this day shall be unto you for a memorial, and ye shall keep it a feast to Jehovah: throughout your generations ye shall keep it a feast by an ordinance for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the first day there shall be to you a holy convocation, and in the seventh day a holy convocation; no manner of work shall be done in them, save that which every man must eat, that only may be done by you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this selfsame day have I brought your hosts out of the land of Egypt: therefore shall ye observe this day throughout your generations by an ordinance for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at even, ye shall eat unleavened bread, until the one and twentieth day of the month at even.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days shall there be no leaven found in your houses: for whosoever eateth that which is leavened, that soul shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he be a sojourner, or one that is born in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall eat nothing leavened; in all your habitations shall ye eat unleavened bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel, and said unto them, Draw out, and take you lambs according to your families, and kill the passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two side-posts with the blood that is in the basin; and none of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jehovah will pass through to smite the Egyptians; and when he seeth the blood upon the lintel, and on the two side-posts, Jehovah will pass over the door, and will not suffer the destroyer to come in unto your houses to smite you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall observe this thing for an ordinance to thee and to thy sons for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, when ye are come to the land which Jehovah will give you, according as he hath promised, that ye shall keep this service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, when your children shall say unto you, What mean ye by this service?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of Jehovah’s passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and delivered our houses. And the people bowed the head and worshipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel went and did so; as Jehovah had commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass at midnight, that Jehovah smote all the first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh that sat on his throne unto the first-born of the captive that was in the dungeon; and all the first-born of cattle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh rose up in the night, he, and all his servants, and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt; for there was not a house where there was not one dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, Rise up, get you forth from among my people, both ye and the children of Israel; and go, serve Jehovah, as ye have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take both your flocks and your herds, as ye have said, and be gone; and bless me also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians were urgent upon the people, to send them out of the land in haste; for they said, We are all dead men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading-troughs being bound up in their clothes upon their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel did according to the word of Moses; and they asked of the Egyptians jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they let them have what they asked. And they despoiled the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand on foot that were men, besides children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a mixed multitude went up also with them; and flocks, and herds, even very much cattle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt; for it was not leavened, because they were thrust out of Egypt, and could not tarry, neither had they prepared for themselves any victuals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the time that the children of Israel dwelt in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass at the end of four hundred and thirty years, even the selfsame day it came to pass, that all the hosts of Jehovah went out from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a night to be much observed unto Jehovah for bringing them out from the land of Egypt: this is that night of Jehovah, to be much observed of all the children of Israel throughout their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses and Aaron, This is the ordinance of the passover: there shall no foreigner eat thereof;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but every man’s servant that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised him, then shall he eat thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sojourner and a hired servant shall not eat thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In one house shall it be eaten; thou shalt not carry forth aught of the flesh abroad out of the house; neither shall ye break a bone thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when a stranger shall sojourn with thee, and will keep the passover to Jehovah, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it; and he shall be as one that is born in the land: but no uncircumcised person shall eat thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One law shall be to him that is home-born, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus did all the children of Israel; as Jehovah commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass the selfsame day, that Jehovah did bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sanctify unto me all the first-born, whatsoever openeth the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and of beast: it is mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto the people, Remember this day, in which ye came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand Jehovah brought you out from this place: there shall no leavened bread be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This day ye go forth in the month Abib.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, when Jehovah shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Amorite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, that thou shalt keep this service in this month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, and in the seventh day shall be a feast to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unleavened bread shall be eaten throughout the seven days; and there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee, neither shall there be leaven seen with thee, in all thy borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt tell thy son in that day, saying, It is because of that which Jehovah did for me when I came forth out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thy hand, and for a memorial between thine eyes, that the law of Jehovah may be in thy mouth: for with a strong hand hath Jehovah brought thee out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt therefore keep this ordinance in its season from year to year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, when Jehovah shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite, as he sware unto thee and to thy fathers, and shall give it thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou shalt set apart unto Jehovah all that openeth the womb, and every firstling which thou hast that cometh of a beast; the males shall be Jehovah’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb; and if thou wilt not redeem it, then thou shalt break its neck: and all the first-born of man among thy sons shalt thou redeem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, when thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying, What is this? that thou shalt say unto him, By strength of hand Jehovah brought us out from Egypt, from the house of bondage:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it came to pass, when Pharaoh would hardly let us go, that Jehovah slew all the first-born in the land of Egypt, both the first-born of man, and the first-born of beast: therefore I sacrifice to Jehovah all that openeth the womb, being males; but all the first-born of my sons I redeem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be for a sign upon thy hand, and for frontlets between thine eyes: for by strength of hand Jehovah brought us forth out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God led them not by the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near; for God said, Lest peradventure the people repent when they see war, and they return to Egypt:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but God led the people about, by the way of the wilderness by the Red Sea: and the children of Israel went up armed out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had straitly sworn the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones away hence with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took their journey from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, in the edge of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah went before them by day in a pillar of cloud, to lead them the way, and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light; that they might go by day and by night:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pillar of cloud by day, and the pillar of fire by night, departed not from before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal-zephon: over against it shall ye encamp by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, They are entangled in the land, the wilderness hath shut them in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and he shall follow after them; and I will get me honor upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host; and the Egyptians shall know that I am Jehovah. And they did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was told the king of Egypt that the people were fled: and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was changed towards the people, and they said, What is this we have done, that we have let Israel go from serving us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made ready his chariot, and took his people with him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt, and captains over all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued after the children of Israel: for the children of Israel went out with a high hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians pursued after them, all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen, and his army, and overtook them encamping by the sea, beside Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Pharaoh drew nigh, the children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and, behold, the Egyptians were marching after them; and they were sore afraid: and the children of Israel cried out unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, hast thou taken us away to die in the wilderness? wherefore hast thou dealt thus with us, to bring us forth out of Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this the word that we spake unto thee in Egypt, saying, Let us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians? For it were better for us to serve the Egyptians, than that we should die in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto the people, Fear ye not, stand still, and see the salvation of Jehovah, which he will work for you to-day: for the Egyptians whom ye have seen to-day, ye shall see them again no more for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah will fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Wherefore criest thou unto me? speak unto the children of Israel, that they go forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lift thou up thy rod, and stretch out thy hand over the sea, and divide it: and the children of Israel shall go into the midst of the sea on dry ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, behold, I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, and they shall go in after them: and I will get me honor upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians shall know that I am Jehovah, when I have gotten me honor upon Pharaoh, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of God, who went before the camp of Israel, removed and went behind them; and the pillar of cloud removed from before them, and stood behind them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it came between the camp of Egypt and the camp of Israel; and there was the cloud and the darkness, yet gave it light by night: and the one came not near the other all the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and Jehovah caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all the night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground: and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians pursued, and went in after them into the midst of the sea, all Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in the morning watch, that Jehovah looked forth upon the host of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and of cloud, and discomfited the host of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took off their chariot wheels, and they drove them heavily; so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel; for Jehovah fighteth for them against the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Stretch out thy hand over the sea, that the waters may come again upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to its strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it; and Jehovah overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the waters returned, and covered the chariots, and the horsemen, even all the host of Pharaoh that went in after them into the sea; there remained not so much as one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the children of Israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea; and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Jehovah saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the sea-shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel saw the great work which Jehovah did upon the Egyptians, and the people feared Jehovah: and they believed in Jehovah, and in his servant Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto Jehovah, and spake, saying,
I will sing unto Jehovah, for he hath triumphed gloriously:
The horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is my strength and song,
And he is become my salvation:
This is my God, and I will praise him;
My father’s God, and I will exalt him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is a man of war:
Jehovah is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pharaoh’s chariots and his host hath he cast into the sea;
And his chosen captains are sunk in the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The deeps cover them:
They went down into the depths like a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy right hand, O Jehovah, is glorious in power,
Thy right hand, O Jehovah, dasheth in pieces the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the greatness of thine excellency thou overthrowest them that rise up against thee: Thou sendest forth thy wrath, it consumeth them as stubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thou didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them:
They sank as lead in the mighty waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is like unto thee, O Jehovah, among the gods?
Who is like thee, glorious in holiness,
Fearful in praises, doing wonders?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou stretchedst out thy right hand,
The earth swallowed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou in thy lovingkindness hast led the people that thou hast redeemed:
Thou hast guided them in thy strength to thy holy habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The peoples have heard, they tremble:
Pangs have taken hold on the inhabitants of Philistia.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thou wilt bring them in, and plant them in the mountain of thine inheritance,
The place, O Jehovah, which thou hast made for thee to dwell in,
The sanctuary, O Lord, which thy hands have established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah shall reign for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the horses of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and Jehovah brought back the waters of the sea upon them; but the children of Israel walked on dry land in the midst of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: And Moses led Israel onward from the Red Sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness, and found no water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter: therefore the name of it was called Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An he cried unto Jehovah; and Jehovah showed him a tree, and he cast it into the waters, and the waters were made sweet. There he made for them a statute and an ordinance, and there he proved them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his eyes, and wilt give ear to his commandments, and keep all his statutes, I will put none of the diseases upon thee, which I have put upon the Egyptians: for I am Jehovah that healeth thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Elim, where were twelve springs of water, and threescore and ten palm-trees: and they encamped there by the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came unto the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron in the wilderness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the children of Israel said unto them, Would that we had died by the hand of Jehovah in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh-pots, when we did eat bread to the full; for ye have brought us forth into this wilderness, to kill this whole assembly with hunger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jehovah unto Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you; and the people shall go out and gather a day’s portion every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass on the sixth day, that they shall prepare that which they bring in, and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron said unto all the children of Israel, At even, then ye shall know that Jehovah hath brought you out from the land of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the morning, then ye shall see the glory of Jehovah; for that he heareth your murmurings against Jehovah: and what are we, that ye murmur against us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, This shall be, when Jehovah shall give you in the evening flesh to eat, and in the morning bread to the full; for that Jehovah heareth your murmurings which ye murmur against him: and what are we? your murmurings are not against us, but against Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Aaron, Say unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, Come near before Jehovah; for he hath heard your murmurings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as Aaron spake unto the whole congregation of the children of Israel, that they looked toward the wilderness, and, behold, the glory of Jehovah appeared in the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel: speak unto them, saying, At even ye shall eat flesh, and in the morning ye shall be filled with bread: and ye shall know that I am Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass at even, that the quails came up, and covered the camp: and in the morning the dew lay round about the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the dew that lay was gone up, behold, upon the face of the wilderness a small round thing, small as the hoar-frost on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the children of Israel saw it, they said one to another, What is it? for they knew not what it was. And Moses said unto them, It is the bread which Jehovah hath given you to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the thing which Jehovah hath commanded. Gather ye of it every man according to his eating; an omer a head, according to the number of your persons, shall ye take it, every man for them that are in his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel did so, and gathered some more, some less.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they measured it with an omer, he that gathered much had nothing over, and he that gathered little had no lack; they gathered every man according to his eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto them, Let no man leave of it till the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and became foul: and Moses was wroth with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gathered it morning by morning, every man according to his eating: and when the sun waxed hot, it melted.
verses.speaker: Narrator
