verses.text: And it came to pass, that on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for each one: and all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, This is that which Jehovah hath spoken, To-morrow is a solemn rest, a holy sabbath unto Jehovah: bake that which ye will bake, and boil that which ye will boil; and all that remaineth over lay up for you to be kept until the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses bade: and it did not become foul, neither was there any worm therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Eat that to-day; for to-day is a sabbath unto Jehovah: to-day ye shall not find it in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days ye shall gather it; but on the seventh day is the sabbath, in it there shall be none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the seventh day, that there went out some of the people to gather, and they found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, How long refuse ye to keep my commandments and my laws?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, for that Jehovah hath given you the sabbath, therefore he giveth you on the sixth day the bread of two days; abide ye every man in his place, let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people rested on the seventh day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the house of Israel called the name thereof Manna: and it was like coriander seed, white; and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, This is the thing which Jehovah hath commanded, Let an omerful of it be kept throughout your generations, that they may see the bread wherewith I fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you forth from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Aaron, Take a pot, and put an omerful of manna therein, and lay it up before Jehovah, to be kept throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jehovah commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel did eat the manna forty years, until they came to a land inhabited; they did eat the manna, until they came unto the borders of the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the congregation of the children of Israel journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, by their journeys, according to the commandment of Jehovah, and encamped in Rephidim: and there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore the people strove with Moses, and said, Give us water that we may drink. And Moses said unto them, Why strive ye with me? Wherefore do ye tempt Jehovah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore hast thou brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses cried unto Jehovah, saying, What shall I do unto this people? they are almost ready to stone me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Pass on before the people, and take with thee of the elders of Israel; and thy rod, wherewith thou smotest the river, take in thy hand, and go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will stand before thee there upon the rock in Horeb; and thou shalt smite the rock, and there shall come water out of it, that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the striving of the children of Israel, and because they tempted Jehovah, saying, Is Jehovah among us, or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came Amalek, and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Joshua, Choose us out men, and go out, fight with Amalek: to-morrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua did as Moses had said to him, and fought with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed; and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses’ hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat thereon; and Aaron and Hur stayed up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua discomfited Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: that I will utterly blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it Jehovah-nissi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, Jehovah hath sworn: Jehovah will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, how that Jehovah had brought Israel out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her two sons; of whom the name of the one was Gershom; for he said, I have been a sojourner in a foreign land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the name of the other was Eliezer; for he said, The God of my father was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife unto Moses into the wilderness where he was encamped, at the mount of God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto Moses, I, thy father-in-law Jethro, am come unto thee, and thy wife, and her two sons with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, and did obeisance, and kissed him; and they asked each other of their welfare; and they came into the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses told his father-in-law all that Jehovah had done unto Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the travail that had come upon them by the way, and how Jehovah delivered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which Jehovah had done to Israel, in that he had delivered them out of the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro said, Blessed be Jehovah, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh; who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I know that Jehovah is greater than all gods; yea, in the thing wherein they dealt proudly against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took a burnt-offering and sacrifices for God: and Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses sat to judge the people: and the people stood about Moses from the morning unto the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this thing that thou doest to the people? why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand about thee from morning unto even?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto his father-in-law, Because the people come unto me to inquire of God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they have a matter, they come unto me; and I judge between a man and his neighbor, and I make them know the statutes of God, and his laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses’ father-in-law said unto him, The thing that thou doest is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou, and this people that is with thee: for the thing is too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God be with thee: be thou for the people to God-ward, and bring thou the causes unto God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt teach them the statutes and the laws, and shalt show them the way wherein they must walk, and the work that they must do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating unjust gain; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and let them judge the people at all seasons: and it shall be, that every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge themselves: so shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear the burden with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people also shall go to their place in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they judged the people at all seasons: the hard causes they brought unto Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses let his father-in-law depart; and he went his way into his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the third month after the children of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day came they into the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were departed from Rephidim, and were come to the wilderness of Sinai, they encamped in the wilderness; and there Israel encamped before the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses went up unto God, and Jehovah called unto him out of the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians, and how I bare you on eagles’ wings, and brought you unto myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye shall be mine own possession from among all peoples: for all the earth is mine:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye shall be unto me a kingdom of priests, and a holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and set before them all these words which Jehovah commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people answered together, and said, All that Jehovah hath spoken we will do. And Moses reported the words of the people unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Lo, I come unto thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with thee, and may also believe thee for ever. And Moses told the words of the people unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Go unto the people, and sanctify them to-day and to-morrow, and let them wash their garments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be ready against the third day; for the third day Jehovah will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt set bounds unto the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, that ye go not up into the mount, or touch the border of it: whosoever toucheth the mount shall be surely put to death:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: no hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned, or shot through; whether it be beast or man, he shall not live: when the trumpet soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses went down from the mount unto the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto the people, Be ready against the third day: come not near a woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the third day, when it was morning, that there were thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the voice of a trumpet exceeding loud; and all the people that were in the camp trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And mount Sinai, the whole of it, smoked, because Jehovah descended upon it in fire; and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the voice of the trumpet waxed louder and louder, Moses spake, and God answered him by a voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah came down upon mount Sinai, to the top of the mount: and Jehovah called Moses to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Go down, charge the people, lest they break through unto Jehovah to gaze, and many of them perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let the priests also, that come near to Jehovah, sanctify themselves, lest Jehovah break forth upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Jehovah, The people cannot come up to mount Sinai: for thou didst charge us, saying, Set bounds about the mount, and sanctify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto him, Go, get thee down; and thou shalt come up, thou, and Aaron with thee: but let not the priests and the people break through to come up unto Jehovah, lest he break forth upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down unto the people, and told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God spake all these words, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am Jehovah thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not make unto thee a graven image, nor any likeness of any thing that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou shalt not bow down thyself unto them, nor serve them; for I Jehovah thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generation of them that hate me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and showing lovingkindness unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not take the name of Jehovah thy God in vain; for Jehovah will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh day is a sabbath unto Jehovah thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy man-servant, nor thy maid-servant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in six days Jehovah made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: wherefore Jehovah blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor thy father and thy mother, that thy days may be long in the land which Jehovah thy God giveth thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not kill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s wife, nor his man-servant, nor his maid-servant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor anything that is thy neighbor’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people perceived the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the voice of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking: and when the people saw it, they trembled, and stood afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto Moses, Speak thou with us, and we will hear; but let not God speak with us, lest we die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto the people, Fear not: for God is come to prove you, and that his fear may be before you, that ye sin not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people stood afar off, and Moses drew near unto the thick darkness where God was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Thus thou shalt say unto the children of Israel, Ye yourselves have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall not make other gods with me; gods of silver, or gods of gold, ye shall not make unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An altar of earth thou shalt make unto me, and shalt sacrifice thereon thy burnt-offerings, and thy peace-offerings, thy sheep, and thine oxen: in every place where I record my name I will come unto thee and I will bless thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if thou make me an altar of stone, thou shalt not build it of hewn stones; for if thou lift up thy tool upon it, thou hast polluted it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither shalt thou go up by steps unto mine altar, that thy nakedness be not uncovered thereon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the ordinances which thou shalt set before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou buy a Hebrew servant, six years he shall serve: and in the seventh he shall go out free for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he come in by himself, he shall go out by himself: if he be married, then his wife shall go out with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his master give him a wife, and she bear him sons or daughters; the wife and her children shall be her master’s, and he shall go out by himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the servant shall plainly say, I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his master shall bring him unto God, and shall bring him to the door, or unto the door-post; and his master shall bore his ear through with an awl; and he shall serve him for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man sell his daughter to be a maid-servant, she shall not go out as the men-servants do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If she please not her master, who hath espoused her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell her unto a foreign people he shall have no power, seeing he hath dealt deceitfully with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he espouse her unto his son, he shall deal with her after the manner of daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he take him another wife; her food, her raiment, and her duty of marriage, shall he not diminish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he do not these three things unto her, then shall she go out for nothing, without money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that smiteth a man, so that he dieth, shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man lie not in wait, but God deliver him into his hand; then I will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man come presumptuously upon his neighbor, to slay him with guile; thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that smiteth his father, or his mother, shall be surely put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that stealeth a man, and selleth him, or if he be found in his hand, he shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that curseth his father or his mother, shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if men contend, and one smite the other with a stone, or with his fist, and he die not, but keep his bed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if he rise again, and walk abroad upon his staff, then shall he that smote him be quit: only he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man smite his servant, or his maid, with a rod, and he die under his hand; he shall surely be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, if he continue a day or two, he shall not be punished: for he is his money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if men strive together, and hurt a woman with child, so that her fruit depart, and yet no harm follow; he shall be surely fined, according as the woman’s husband shall lay upon him; and he shall pay as the judges determine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any harm follow, then thou shalt give life for life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man smite the eye of his servant, or the eye of his maid, and destroy it; he shall let him go free for his eye’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he smite out his man-servant’s tooth, or his maid-servant’s tooth; he shall let him go free for his tooth’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if an ox gore a man or a woman to death, the ox shall be surely stoned, and its flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be quit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the ox was wont to gore in time past, and it hath been testified to its owner, and he hath not kept it in, but it hath killed a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and its owner also shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there be laid on him a ransom, then he shall give for the redemption of his life whatsoever is laid upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it have gored a son, or have gored a daughter, according to this judgment shall it be done unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the ox gore a man-servant or a maid-servant, there shall be given unto their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man shall open a pit, or if a man shall dig a pit and not cover it, and an ox or an ass fall therein,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the owner of the pit shall make it good; he shall give money unto the owner thereof, and the dead beast shall be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if one man’s ox hurt another’s, so that it dieth, then they shall sell the live ox, and divide the price of it; and the dead also they shall divide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if it be known that the ox was wont to gore in time past, and its owner hath not kept it in; he shall surely pay ox for ox, and the dead beast shall be his own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall pay five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the thief be found breaking in, and be smitten so that he dieth, there shall be no bloodguiltiness for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the sun be risen upon him, there shall be bloodguiltiness for him; he shall make restitution: if he have nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the theft be found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall pay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall let his beast loose, and it feed in another man’s field; of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the shocks of grain, or the standing grain, or the field are consumed; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man shall deliver unto his neighbor money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the man’s house; if the thief be found, he shall pay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall come near unto God, to see whether he have not put his hand unto his neighbor’s goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every matter of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, whereof one saith, This is it, the cause of both parties shall come before God; he whom God shall condemn shall pay double unto his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man deliver unto his neighbor an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the oath of Jehovah shall be between them both, whether he hath not put his hand unto his neighbor’s goods; and the owner thereof shall accept it, and he shall not make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto the owner thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it be torn in pieces, let him bring it for witness; he shall not make good that which was torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man borrow aught of his neighbor, and it be hurt, or die, the owner thereof not being with it, he shall surely make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the owner thereof be with it, he shall not make it good: if it be a hired thing, it came for its hire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man entice a virgin that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely pay a dowry for her to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not suffer a sorceress to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that sacrificeth unto any god, save unto Jehovah only, shall be utterly destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a sojourner shalt thou not wrong, neither shalt thou oppress him: for ye were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou afflict them at all, and they cry at all unto me, I will surely hear their cry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou lend money to any of my people with thee that is poor, thou shalt not be to him as a creditor; neither shall ye lay upon him interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou at all take thy neighbor’s garment to pledge, thou shalt restore it unto him before the sun goeth down:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for that is his only covering, it is his garment for his skin: wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth unto me, that I will hear; for I am gracious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not revile God, nor curse a ruler of thy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not delay to offer of thy harvest, and of the outflow of thy presses. The first-born of thy sons shalt thou give unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen, and with thy sheep: seven days it shall be with its dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall be holy men unto me: therefore ye shall not eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not take up a false report: put not thy hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to turn aside after a multitude to wrest justice:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither shalt thou favor a poor man in his cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou meet thine enemy’s ox or his ass going astray, thou shalt surely bring it back to him again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou see the ass of him that hateth thee lying under his burden, thou shalt forbear to leave him, thou shalt surely release it with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not wrest the justice due to thy poor in his cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take no bribe: for a bribe blindeth them that have sight, and perverteth the words of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a sojourner shalt thou not oppress: for ye know the heart of a sojourner, seeing ye were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And six years thou shalt sow thy land, and shalt gather in the increase thereof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and lie fallow, that the poor of thy people may eat: and what they leave the beast of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt deal with thy vineyard, and with thy oliveyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days thou shalt do thy work, and on the seventh day thou shalt rest; that thine ox and thine ass may have rest, and the son of thy handmaid, and the sojourner, may be refreshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in all things that I have said unto you take ye heed: and make no mention of the name of other gods, neither let it be heard out of thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times thou shalt keep a feast unto me in the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep: seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, at the time appointed in the month Abib (for in it thou camest out from Egypt); and none shall appear before me empty:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the feast of harvest, the first-fruits of thy labors, which thou sowest in the field: and the feast of ingathering, at the end of the year, when thou gatherest in thy labors out of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the Lord Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the fat of my feast remain all night until the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first of the first-fruits of thy ground thou shalt bring into the house of Jehovah thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I send an angel before thee, to keep thee by the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take ye heed before him, and hearken unto his voice; provoke him not; for he will not pardon your transgression: for my name is in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if thou shalt indeed hearken unto his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For mine angel shall go before thee, and bring thee in unto the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Canaanite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite: and I will cut them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works; but thou shalt utterly overthrow them, and break in pieces their pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall serve Jehovah your God, and he will bless thy bread, and thy water; and I will take sickness away from the midst of thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall none cast her young, nor be barren, in thy land: the number of thy days I will fulfil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send my terror before thee, and will discomfit all the people to whom thou shalt come, and I will make all thine enemies turn their backs unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will send the hornet before thee, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite, from before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not drive them out from before thee in one year, lest the land become desolate, and the beasts of the field multiply against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By little and little I will drive them out from before thee, until thou be increased, and inherit the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will set thy border from the Red Sea even unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness unto the River: for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand; and thou shalt drive them out before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me; for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto Moses, Come up unto Jehovah, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship ye afar off:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses alone shall come near unto Jehovah; but they shall not come near; neither shall the people go up with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses came and told the people all the words of Jehovah, and all the ordinances: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words which Jehovah hath spoken will we do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses wrote all the words of Jehovah, and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the mount, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent young men of the children of Israel, who offered burnt-offerings, and sacrificed peace-offerings of oxen unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basins; and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that Jehovah hath spoken will we do, and be obedient.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold the blood of the covenant, which Jehovah hath made with you concerning all these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they saw the God of Israel; and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of sapphire stone, and as it were the very heaven for clearness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: and they beheld God, and did eat and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount, and be there: and I will give thee the tables of stone, and the law and the commandment, which I have written, that thou mayest teach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses rose up, and Joshua his minister: and Moses went up into the mount of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again unto you: and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you; whosoever hath a cause, let him come near unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses went up into the mount, and the cloud covered the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the glory of Jehovah abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days: and the seventh day he called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the appearance of the glory of Jehovah was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses entered into the midst of the cloud, and went up into the mount: and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they take for me an offering: of every man whose heart maketh him willing ye shall take my offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the offering which ye shall take of them: gold, and silver, and brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats’ hair,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rams’ skins dyed red, and sealskins, and acacia wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: onyx stones, and stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all that I show thee, the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of all the furniture thereof, even so shall ye make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall make an ark of acacia wood: two cubits and a half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, within and without shalt thou overlay it, and shalt make upon it a crown of gold round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt cast four rings of gold for it, and put them in the four feet thereof; and two rings shall be on the one side of it, and two rings on the other side of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make staves of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put the staves into the rings on the sides of the ark, wherewith to bear the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The staves shall be in the rings of the ark: they shall not be taken from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put into the ark the testimony which I shall give thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make a mercy-seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make two cherubim of gold; of beaten work shalt thou make them, at the two ends of the mercy-seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And make one cherub at the one end, and one cherub at the other end: of one piece with the mercy-seat shall ye make the cherubim on the two ends thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cherubim shall spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy-seat with their wings, with their faces one to another; toward the mercy-seat shall the faces of the cherubim be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put the mercy-seat above upon the ark; and in the ark thou shalt put the testimony that I shall give thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there I will meet with thee, and I will commune with thee from above the mercy-seat, from between the two cherubim which are upon the ark of the testimony, of all things which I will give thee in commandment unto the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make a table of acacia wood: two cubits shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, and make thereto a crown of gold round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make unto it a border of a handbreadth round about; and thou shalt make a golden crown to the border thereof round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that are on the four feet thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Close by the border shall the rings be, for places for the staves to bear the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the staves of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold, that the table may be borne with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the dishes thereof, and the spoons thereof, and the flagons thereof, and the bowls thereof, wherewith to pour out: of pure gold shalt thou make them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt set upon the table showbread before me alway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make a candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work shall the candlestick be made, even its base, and its shaft; its cups, its knops, and its flowers, shall be of one piece with it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there shall be six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three cups made like almond-blossoms in one branch, a knop and a flower; and three cups made like almond-blossoms in the other branch, a knop and a flower: so for the six branches going out of the candlestick:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the candlestick four cups made like almond-blossoms, the knops thereof, and the flowers thereof;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of the candlestick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their knops and their branches shall be of one piece with it; the whole of it one beaten work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the lamps thereof, seven: and they shall light the lamps thereof, to give light over against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the snuffers thereof, and the snuffdishes thereof, shall be of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of a talent of pure gold shall it be made, with all these vessels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And see that thou make them after their pattern, which hath been showed thee in the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover thou shalt make the tabernacle with ten curtains; of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, with cherubim the work of the skilful workman shalt thou make them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: all the curtains shall have one measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five curtains shall be coupled together one to another; and the other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling; and likewise shalt thou make in the edge of the curtain that is outmost in the second coupling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fifty loops shalt thou make in the one curtain, and fifty loops shalt thou make in the edge of the curtain that is in the second coupling; the loops shall be opposite one to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make fifty clasps of gold, and couple the curtains one to another with the clasps: and the tabernacle shall be one whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make curtains of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains shalt thou make them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: the eleven curtains shall have one measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and shalt double over the sixth curtain in the forefront of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain that is outmost in the coupling, and fifty loops upon the edge of the curtain which is outmost in the second coupling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make fifty clasps of brass, and put the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together, that it may be one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the overhanging part that remaineth of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remaineth, shall hang over the back of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cubit on the one side, and the cubit on the other side, of that which remaineth in the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side, to cover it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering of sealskins above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two tenons shall there be in each board, joined one to another: thus shalt thou make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side southward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, twenty boards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the hinder part of the tabernacle westward thou shalt make six boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two boards shalt thou make for the corners of the tabernacle in the hinder part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall be double beneath, and in like manner they shall be entire unto the top thereof unto one ring: thus shall it be for them both; they shall be for the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall be eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make bars of acacia wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the hinder part westward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the middle bar in the midst of the boards shall pass through from end to end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt overlay the boards with gold, and make their rings of gold for places for the bars: and thou shalt overlay the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt rear up the tabernacle according to the fashion thereof which hath been showed thee in the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make a veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubim the work of the skilful workman shall it be made:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt hang it upon four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold; their hooks shall be of gold, upon four sockets of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt hang up the veil under the clasps, and shalt bring in thither within the veil the ark of the testimony: and the veil shall separate unto you between the holy place and the most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put the mercy-seat upon the ark of the testimony in the most holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt set the table without the veil, and the candlestick over against the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south: and thou shalt put the table on the north side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make a screen for the door of the Tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make for the screen five pillars of acacia, and overlay them with gold; their hooks shall be of gold: and thou shalt cast five sockets of brass for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and the height thereof shall be three cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the horns of it upon the four corners thereof; the horns thereof shall be of one piece with it: and thou shalt overlay it with brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make its pots to take away its ashes, and its shovels, and its basins, and its flesh-hooks, and its firepans: all the vessels thereof thou shalt make of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make for it a grating of network of brass; and upon the net shalt thou make four brazen rings in the four corners thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put it under the ledge round the altar beneath, that the net may reach halfway up the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make staves for the altar, staves of acacia wood, and overlay them with brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the staves thereof shall be put into the rings, and the staves shall be upon the two sides of the altar, in bearing it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hollow with planks shalt thou make it: as it hath been showed thee in the mount, so shall they make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the court of the tabernacle: for the south side southward there shall be hangings for the court of fine twined linen a hundred cubits long for one side:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the pillars thereof shall be twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings a hundred cubits long, and the pillars thereof twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the breadth of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits; their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings for the one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the other side shall be hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the gate of the court shall be a screen of twenty cubits, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer; their pillars four, and their sockets four.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the pillars of the court round about shall be filleted with silver; their hooks of silver, and their sockets of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of the court shall be a hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty every where, and the height five cubits, of fine twined linen, and their sockets of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the instruments of the tabernacle in all the service thereof, and all the pins thereof, and all the pins of the court, shall be of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the tent of meeting, without the veil which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall keep it in order from evening to morning before Jehovah: it shall be a statute for ever throughout their generations on the behalf of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And bring thou near unto thee Aaron thy brother, and his sons with him, from among the children of Israel, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office, even Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, for glory and for beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt speak unto all that are wise-hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they make Aaron’s garments to sanctify him, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the garments which they shall make: a breastplate, and an ephod, and a robe, and a coat of checker work, a mitre, and a girdle: and they shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, and his sons, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall take the gold, and the blue, and the purple, and the scarlet, and the fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, and purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the skilful workman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall have two shoulder-pieces joined to the two ends thereof, that it may be joined together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the skilfully woven band, which is upon it, wherewith to gird it on, shall be like the work thereof and of the same piece; of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take two onyx stones, and grave on them the names of the children of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the six that remain on the other stone, according to their birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, shalt thou engrave the two stones, according to the names of the children of Israel: thou shalt make them to be inclosed in settings of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put the two stones upon the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel: and Aaron shall bear their names before Jehovah upon his two shoulders for a memorial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make settings of gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two chains of pure gold; like cords shalt thou make them, of wreathen work: and thou shalt put the wreathen chains on the settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make a breastplate of judgment, the work of the skilful workman; like the work of the ephod thou shalt make it; of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, shalt thou make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foursquare it shall be and double; a span shall be the length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt set in it settings of stones, four rows of stones: a row of sardius, topaz, and carbuncle shall be the first row;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second row an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be inclosed in gold in their settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the stones shall be according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names; like the engravings of a signet, every one according to his name, they shall be for the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make upon the breastplate chains like cords, of wreathen work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make upon the breastplate two rings of gold, and shalt put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other two ends of the two wreathen chains thou shalt put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod in the forepart thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make two rings of gold, and thou shalt put them upon the two ends of the breastplate, upon the edge thereof, which is toward the side of the ephod inward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make two rings of gold, and shalt put them on the two shoulder-pieces of the ephod underneath, in the forepart thereof, close by the coupling thereof, above the skilfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall bind the breastplate by the rings thereof unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be upon the skilfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate be not loosed from the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment upon his heart, when he goeth in unto the holy place, for a memorial before Jehovah continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim; and they shall be upon Aaron’s heart, when he goeth in before Jehovah: and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel upon his heart before Jehovah continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall have a hole for the head in the midst thereof: it shall have a binding of woven work round about the hole of it, as it were the hole of a coat of mail, that it be not rent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And upon the skirts of it thou shalt make pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, round about the skirts thereof; and bells of gold between them round about:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the skirts of the robe round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be upon Aaron to minister: and the sound thereof shall be heard when he goeth in unto the holy place before Jehovah, and when he cometh out, that he die not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make a plate of pure gold, and grave upon it, like the engravings of a signet, Holy to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put it on a lace of blue, and it shall be upon the mitre; upon the forefront of the mitre it shall be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be upon Aaron’s forehead, and Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the children of Israel shall hallow in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always upon his forehead, that they may be accepted before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt weave the coat in checker work of fine linen, and thou shalt make a mitre of fine linen, and thou shalt make a girdle, the work of the embroiderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for Aaron’s sons thou shalt make coats, and thou shalt make for them girdles, and head-tires shalt thou make for them, for glory and for beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put them upon Aaron thy brother, and upon his sons with him, and shalt anoint them, and consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make them linen breeches to cover the flesh of their nakedness; from the loins even unto the thighs they shall reach:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall be upon Aaron, and upon his sons, when they go in unto the tent of meeting, or when they come near unto the altar to minister in the holy place; that they bear not iniquity, and die: it shall be a statute for ever unto him and unto his seed after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the thing that thou shalt do unto them to hallow them, to minister unto me in the priest’s office: take one young bullock and two rams without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened mingled with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil: of fine wheaten flour shalt thou make them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bullock and the two rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron and his sons thou shalt bring unto the door of the tent of meeting, and shalt wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take the garments, and put upon Aaron the coat, and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastplate, and gird him with the skilfully woven band of the ephod;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt set the mitre upon his head, and put the holy crown upon the mitre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou take the anointing oil, and pour it upon his head, and anoint him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt bring his sons, and put coats upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt gird them with girdles, Aaron and his sons, and bind head-tires on them: and they shall have the priesthood by a perpetual statute: and thou shalt consecrate Aaron and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt bring the bullock before the tent of meeting: and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands upon the head of the bullock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt kill the bullock before Jehovah, at the door of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock, and put it upon the horns of the altar with thy finger; and thou shalt pour out all the blood at the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul upon the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and burn them upon the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the flesh of the bullock, and its skin, and its dung, shalt thou burn with fire without the camp: it is a sin-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt also take the one ram; and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands upon the head of the ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt slay the ram, and thou shalt take its blood, and sprinkle it round about upon the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt cut the ram into its pieces, and wash its inwards, and its legs, and put them with its pieces, and with its head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the altar: it is a burnt-offering unto Jehovah; it is a sweet savor, an offering made by fire unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take the other ram; and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands upon the head of the ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou kill the ram, and take of its blood, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and upon the tip of the right ear of his sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take of the blood that is upon the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be hallowed, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons’ garments with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also thou shalt take of the ram the fat, and the fat tail, and the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul of the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and the right thigh (for it is a ram of consecration),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one loaf of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, out of the basket of unleavened bread that is before Jehovah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt put the whole upon the hands of Aaron, and upon the hands of his sons, and shalt wave them for a wave-offering before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take them from their hands, and burn them on the altar upon the burnt-offering, for a sweet savor before Jehovah: it is an offering made by fire unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take the breast of Aaron’s ram of consecration, and wave it for a wave-offering before Jehovah: and it shall be thy portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt sanctify the breast of the wave-offering, and the thigh of the heave-offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of consecration, even of that which is for Aaron, and of that which is for his sons:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it shall be for Aaron and his sons as their portion for ever from the children of Israel; for it is a heave-offering: and it shall be a heave-offering from the children of Israel of the sacrifices of their peace-offerings, even their heave-offering unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the holy garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him, to be anointed in them, and to be consecrated in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days shall the son that is priest in his stead put them on, when he cometh into the tent of meeting to minister in the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take the ram of consecration, and boil its flesh in a holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, at the door of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall eat those things wherewith atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them: but a stranger shall not eat thereof, because they are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if aught of the flesh of the consecration, or of the bread, remain unto the morning, then thou shalt burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus shalt thou do unto Aaron, and to his sons, according to all that I have commanded thee: seven days shalt thou consecrate them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every day shalt thou offer the bullock of sin-offering for atonement: and thou shalt cleanse the altar, when thou makest atonement for it; and thou shalt anoint it, to sanctify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days thou shalt make atonement for the altar, and sanctify it: and the altar shall be most holy; whatsoever toucheth the altar shall be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is that which thou shalt offer upon the altar: two lambs a year old day by day continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one lamb thou shalt offer in the morning; and the other lamb thou shalt offer at even:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with the one lamb a tenth part of an ephah of fine flour mingled with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil; and the fourth part of a hin of wine for a drink-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other lamb thou shalt offer at even, and shalt do thereto according to the meal-offering of the morning, and according to the drink-offering thereof, for a sweet savor, an offering made by fire unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be a continual burnt-offering throughout your generations at the door of the tent of meeting before Jehovah, where I will meet with you, to speak there unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there I will meet with the children of Israel; and the Tent shall be sanctified by my glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will sanctify the tent of meeting, and the altar: Aaron also and his sons will I sanctify, to minister to me in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall know that I am Jehovah their God, that brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I might dwell among them: I am Jehovah their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make an altar to burn incense upon: of acacia wood shalt thou make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A cubit shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof; foursquare shall it be; and two cubits shall be the height thereof: the horns thereof shall be of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, the top thereof, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns thereof; and thou shalt make unto it a crown of gold round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two golden rings shalt thou make for it under the crown thereof; upon the two ribs thereof, upon the two sides of it shalt thou make them; and they shall be for places for staves wherewith to bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt make the staves of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put it before the veil that is by the ark of the testimony, before the mercy-seat that is over the testimony, where I will meet with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron shall burn thereon incense of sweet spices: every morning, when he dresseth the lamps, he shall burn it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Aaron lighteth the lamps at even, he shall burn it, a perpetual incense before Jehovah throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall offer no strange incense thereon, nor burnt-offering, nor meal-offering; and ye shall pour no drink-offering thereon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron shall make atonement upon the horns of it once in the year; with the blood of the sin-offering of atonement once in the year shall he make atonement for it throughout your generations: it is most holy unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou takest the sum of the children of Israel, according to those that are numbered of them, then shall they give every man a ransom for his soul unto Jehovah, when thou numberest them; that there be no plague among them, when thou numberest them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This they shall give, every one that passeth over unto them that are numbered: half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs), half a shekel for an offering to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one that passeth over unto them that are numbered, from twenty years old and upward, shall give the offering of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less, than the half shekel, when they give the offering of Jehovah, to make atonement for your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take the atonement money from the children of Israel, and shalt appoint it for the service of the tent of meeting; that it may be a memorial for the children of Israel before Jehovah, to make atonement for your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt also make a laver of brass, and the base thereof of brass, whereat to wash. And thou shalt put it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and thou shalt put water therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet thereat:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they go into the tent of meeting, they shall wash with water, that they die not; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they die not: and it shall be a statute for ever to them, even to him and to his seed throughout their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take thou also unto thee the chief spices: of flowing myrrh five hundred shekels, and of sweet cinnamon half so much, even two hundred and fifty, and of sweet calamus two hundred and fifty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of cassia five hundred, after the shekel of the sanctuary, and of olive oil a hin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt make it a holy anointing oil, a perfume compounded after the art of the perfumer: it shall be a holy anointing oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt anoint therewith the tent of meeting, and the ark of the testimony,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the table and all the vessels thereof, and the candlestick and the vessels thereof, and the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of burnt-offering with all the vessels thereof, and the laver and the base thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt sanctify them, that they may be most holy: whatsoever toucheth them shall be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt anoint Aaron and his sons, and sanctify them, that they may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, This shall be a holy anointing oil unto me throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon the flesh of man shall it not be poured, neither shall ye make any like it, according to the composition thereof: it is holy, and it shall be holy unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever compoundeth any like it, or whosoever putteth any of it upon a stranger, he shall be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Take unto thee sweet spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum; sweet spices with pure frankincense: of each shall there be a like weight;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt make of it incense, a perfume after the art of the perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt beat some of it very small, and put of it before the testimony in the tent of meeting, where I will meet with thee: it shall be unto you most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the incense which thou shalt make, according to the composition thereof ye shall not make for yourselves: it shall be unto thee holy for Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever shall make like unto that, to smell thereof, he shall be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to devise skilful works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all manner of workmanship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, behold, I have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and in the heart of all that are wise-hearted I have put wisdom, that they may make all that I have commanded thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tent of meeting, and the ark of the testimony, and the mercy-seat that is thereupon, and all the furniture of the Tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the table and its vessels, and the pure candlestick with all its vessels, and the altar of incense,
