verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of burnt-offering with all its vessels, and the laver and its base,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the finely wrought garments, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest’s office,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the anointing oil, and the incense of sweet spices for the holy place: according to all that I have commanded thee shall they do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak thou also unto the children of Israel, saying, Verily ye shall keep my sabbaths: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am Jehovah who sanctifieth you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall keep the sabbath therefore; for it is holy unto you: every one that profaneth it shall surely be put to death; for whosoever doeth any work therein, that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days shall work be done; but on the seventh day is a sabbath of solemn rest, holy to Jehovah; whosoever doeth any work on the sabbath day, he shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore the children of Israel shall keep the sabbath, to observe the sabbath throughout their generations, for a perpetual covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a sign between me and the children of Israel for ever: for in six days Jehovah made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested, and was refreshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave unto Moses, when he had made an end of communing with him upon mount Sinai, the two tables of the testimony, tables of stone, written with the finger of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mount, the people gathered themselves together unto Aaron, and said unto him, Up, make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we know not what is become of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron said unto them, Break off the golden rings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people brake off the golden rings which were in their ears, and brought them unto Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he received it at their hand, and fashioned it with a graving tool, and made it a molten calf: and they said, These are thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron made proclamation, and said, To-morrow shall be a feast to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose up early on the morrow, and offered burnt-offerings, and brought peace-offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, Go, get thee down; for thy people, that thou broughtest up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them: they have made them a molten calf, and have worshipped it, and have sacrificed unto it, and said, These are thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, I have seen this people, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now therefore let me alone, that my wrath may wax hot against them, and that I may consume them: and I will make of thee a great nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses besought Jehovah his God, and said, Jehovah, why doth thy wrath wax hot against thy people, that thou hast brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore should the Egyptians speak, saying, For evil did he bring them forth, to slay them in the mountains, and to consume them from the face of the earth? Turn from thy fierce wrath, and repent of this evil against thy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, thy servants, to whom thou swarest by thine own self, and saidst unto them, I will multiply your seed as the stars of heaven, and all this land that I have spoken of will I give unto your seed, and they shall inherit it for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah repented of the evil which he said he would do unto his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses turned, and went down from the mount, with the two tables of the testimony in his hand; tables that were written on both their sides; on the one side and on the other were they written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tables were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, graven upon the tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said unto Moses, There is a noise of war in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, It is not the voice of them that shout for mastery, neither is it the voice of them that cry for being overcome; but the noise of them that sing do I hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as soon as he came nigh unto the camp, that he saw the calf and the dancing: and Moses’ anger waxed hot, and he cast the tables out of his hands, and brake them beneath the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took the calf which they had made, and burnt it with fire, and ground it to powder, and strewed it upon the water, and made the children of Israel drink of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Aaron, What did this people unto thee, that thou hast brought a great sin upon them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron said, Let not the anger of my lord wax hot: thou knowest the people, that they are set on evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they said unto me, Make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we know not what is become of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said unto them, Whosoever hath any gold, let them break it off: so they gave it me; and I cast it into the fire, and there came out this calf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses saw that the people were broken loose (for Aaron had let them loose for a derision among their enemies),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Moses stood in the gate of the camp, and said, Whoso is on Jehovah’s side, let him come unto me. And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves together unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Put ye every man his sword upon his thigh, and go to and fro from gate to gate throughout the camp, and slay every man his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses: and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Consecrate yourselves to-day to Jehovah, yea, every man against his son, and against his brother; that he may bestow upon you a blessing this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses said unto the people, Ye have sinned a great sin: and now I will go up unto Jehovah; peradventure I shall make atonement for your sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses returned unto Jehovah, and said, Oh, this people have sinned a great sin, and have made them gods of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet now, if thou wilt forgive their sin—; and if not, blot me, I pray thee, out of thy book which thou hast written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Whosoever hath sinned against me, him will I blot out of my book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now go, lead the people unto the place of which I have spoken unto thee: behold, mine angel shall go before thee; nevertheless in the day when I visit, I will visit their sin upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah smote the people, because they made the calf, which Aaron made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, Depart, go up hence, thou and the people that thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt, unto the land of which I sware unto Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, Unto thy seed will I give it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will send an angel before thee; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto a land flowing with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of thee; for thou art a stiffnecked people; lest I consume thee in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the people heard these evil tidings, they mourned: and no man did put on him his ornaments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Say unto the children of Israel, Ye are a stiffnecked people; if I go up into the midst of thee for one moment, I shall consume thee: therefore now put off thy ornaments from thee, that I may know what to do unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments from mount Horeb onward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses used to take the tent and to pitch it without the camp, afar off from the camp; and he called it, The tent of meeting. And it came to pass, that every one that sought Jehovah went out unto the tent of meeting, which was without the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Moses went out unto the Tent, that all the people rose up, and stood, every man at his tent door, and looked after Moses, until he was gone into the Tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Moses entered into the Tent, the pillar of cloud descended, and stood at the door of the Tent: and Jehovah spake with Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people saw the pillar of cloud stand at the door of the Tent: and all the people rose up and worshipped, every man at his tent door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses face to face, as a man speaketh unto his friend. And he turned again into the camp: but his minister Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, departed not out of the Tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Jehovah, See, thou sayest unto me, Bring up this people: and thou hast not let me know whom thou wilt send with me. Yet thou hast said, I know thee by name, and thou hast also found favor in my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found favor in thy sight, show me now thy ways, that I may know thee, to the end that I may find favor in thy sight: and consider that this nation is thy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, If thy presence go not with me, carry us not up hence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For wherein now shall it be known that I have found favor in thy sight, I and thy people? is it not in that thou goest with us, so that we are separated, I and thy people, from all the people that are upon the face of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, I will do this thing also that thou hast spoken; for thou hast found favor in my sight, and I know thee by name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Show me, I pray thee, thy glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, I will make all my goodness pass before thee, and will proclaim the name of Jehovah before thee; and I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Thou canst not see my face; for man shall not see me and live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said, Behold, there is a place by me, and thou shalt stand upon the rock:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it shall come to pass, while my glory passeth by, that I will put thee in a cleft of the rock, and will cover thee with my hand until I have passed by:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will take away my hand, and thou shalt see my back; but my face shall not be seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first: and I will write upon the tables the words that were on the first tables, which thou brakest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And be ready by the morning, and come up in the morning unto mount Sinai, and present thyself there to me on the top of the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no man shall come up with thee; neither let any man be seen throughout all the mount; neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he hewed two tables of stone like unto the first; and Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up unto mount Sinai, as Jehovah had commanded him, and took in his hand two tables of stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah passed by before him, and proclaimed, Jehovah, Jehovah, a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in lovingkindness and truth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: keeping lovingkindness for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin; and that will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children’s children, upon the third and upon the fourth generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses made haste, and bowed his head toward the earth, and worshipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, If now I have found favor in thy sight, O Lord, let the Lord, I pray thee, go in the midst of us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Behold, I make a covenant: before all thy people I will do marvels, such as have not been wrought in all the earth, nor in any nation; and all the people among which thou art shall see the work of Jehovah; for it is a terrible thing that I do with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Observe thou that which I command thee this day: behold, I drive out before thee the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land whither thou goest, lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but ye shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and ye shall cut down their Asherim
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for thou shalt worship no other god: for Jehovah, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they play the harlot after their gods, and sacrifice unto their gods, and one call thee and thou eat of his sacrifice;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou take of their daughters unto thy sons, and their daughters play the harlot after their gods, and make thy sons play the harlot after their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt make thee no molten gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep. Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, at the time appointed in the month Abib; for in the month Abib thou camest out from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that openeth the womb is mine; and all thy cattle that is male, the firstlings of cow and sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb: and if thou wilt not redeem it, then thou shalt break its neck. All the first-born of thy sons thou shalt redeem. And none shall appear before me empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days thou shalt work, but on the seventh day thou shalt rest: in plowing time and in harvest thou shalt rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt observe the feast of weeks, even of the first-fruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of ingathering at the year’s end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times in the year shall all thy males appear before the Lord Jehovah, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will cast out nations before thee, and enlarge thy borders: neither shall any man desire thy land, when thou goest up to appear before Jehovah thy God three times in the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the sacrifice of the feast of the passover be left unto the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first of the first-fruits of thy ground thou shalt bring unto the house of Jehovah thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Write thou these words: for after the tenor of these words I have made a covenant with thee and with Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was there with Jehovah forty days and forty nights; he did neither eat bread, nor drink water. And he wrote upon the tables the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Moses came down from mount Sinai with the two tables of the testimony in Moses’ hand, when he came down from the mount, that Moses knew not that the skin of his face shone by reason of his speaking with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone; and they were afraid to come nigh him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses called unto them; and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned unto him: and Moses spake to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward all the children of Israel came nigh: and he gave them in commandment all that Jehovah had spoken with him in mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses had done speaking with them, he put a veil on his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Moses went in before Jehovah to speak with him, he took the veil off, until he came out; and he came out, and spake unto the children of Israel that which he was commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel saw the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses’ face shone; and Moses put the veil upon his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses assembled all the congregation of the children of Israel, and said unto them, These are the words which Jehovah hath commanded, that ye should do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days shall work be done; but on the seventh day there shall be to you a holy day, a sabbath of solemn rest to Jehovah: whosoever doeth any work therein shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations upon the sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses spake unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which Jehovah commanded, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take ye from among you an offering unto Jehovah; whosoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it, Jehovah’s offering: gold, and silver, and brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats’ hair,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rams’ skins dyed red, and sealskins, and acacia wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and oil for the light, and spices for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and onyx stones, and stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let every wise-hearted man among you come, and make all that Jehovah hath commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tabernacle, its tent, and its covering, its clasps, and its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ark, and the staves thereof, the mercy-seat, and the veil of the screen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table, and its staves, and all its vessels, and the showbread;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the candlestick also for the light, and its vessels, and its lamps, and the oil for the light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of incense, and its staves, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the screen for the door, at the door of the tabernacle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of burnt-offering, with its grating of brass, its staves, and all its vessels, the laver and its base;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings of the court, the pillars thereof, and their sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pins of the tabernacle, and the pins of the court, and their cords;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the finely wrought garments, for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came, every one whose heart stirred him up, and every one whom his spirit made willing, and brought Jehovah’s offering, for the work of the tent of meeting, and for all the service thereof, and for the holy garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came, both men and women, as many as were willing-hearted, and brought brooches, and ear-rings, and signet-rings, and armlets, all jewels of gold; even every man that offered an offering of gold unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every man, with whom was found blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats’ hair, and rams’ skins dyed red, and sealskins, brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one that did offer an offering of silver and brass brought Jehovah’s offering; and every man, with whom was found acacia wood for any work of the service, brought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the women that were wise-hearted did spin with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, the blue, and the purple, the scarlet, and the fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun the goats’ hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rulers brought the onyx stones, and the stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the spice, and the oil; for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel brought a freewill-offering unto Jehovah; every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all the work, which Jehovah had commanded to be made by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto the children of Israel, See, Jehovah hath called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to devise skilful works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all manner of skilful workmanship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he hath put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Them hath he filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of workmanship, of the engraver, and of the skilful workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of them that do any workmanship, and of those that devise skilful works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bezalel and Oholiab shall work, and every wise-hearted man, in whom Jehovah hath put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that Jehovah hath commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whose heart Jehovah had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they received of Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, wherewith to make it. And they brought yet unto him freewill-offerings every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they wrought;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work which Jehovah commanded to make.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the wise-hearted men among them that wrought the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains; of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, with cherubim, the work of the skilful workman, Bezalel made them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain was eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: all the curtains had one measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he coupled five curtains one to another: and the other five curtains he coupled one to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling: likewise he made in the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the second coupling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fifty loops made he in the one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain that was in the second coupling: the loops were opposite one to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains one to another with the clasps: so the tabernacle was one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made curtains of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the breadth of each curtain: the eleven curtains had one measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which was outmost in the second coupling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made fifty clasps of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering of sealskins above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the boards for the tabernacle, of acacia wood, standing up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten cubits was the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each board had two tenons, joined one to another: thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the boards for the tabernacle: twenty boards for the south side southward;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the hinder part of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the hinder part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were double beneath; and in like manner they were entire unto the top thereof unto one ring: thus he did to both of them in the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; under every board two sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made bars of acacia wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the middle bar to pass through in the midst of the boards from the one end to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold for places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubim, the work of the skilful workman, made he it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made thereunto four pillars of acacia, and overlaid them with gold: their hooks were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made a screen for the door of the Tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the five pillars of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold; and their five sockets were of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood: two cubits and a half was the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he overlaid it with pure gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cast for it four rings of gold, in the four feet thereof; even two rings on the one side of it, and two rings on the other side of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made staves of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made a mercy-seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half was the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made two cherubim of gold; of beaten work made he them, at the two ends of the mercy-seat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one cherub at the one end, and one cherub at the other end: of one piece with the mercy-seat made he the cherubim at the two ends thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cherubim spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy-seat with their wings, with their faces one to another; toward the mercy-seat were the faces of the cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the table of acacia wood: two cubits was the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made thereto a crown of gold round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made unto it a border of a handbreadth round about, and made a golden crown to the border thereof round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that were on the four feet thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Close by the border were the rings, the places for the staves to bear the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the staves of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the vessels which were upon the table, the dishes thereof, and the spoons thereof, and the bowls thereof, and the flagons thereof, wherewith to pour out, of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work made he the candlestick, even its base, and its shaft; its cups, it knops, and its flowers, were of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three cups made like almond-blossoms in one branch, a knop and a flower, and three cups made like almond-blossoms in the other branch, a knop and a flower: so for the six branches going out of the candlestick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the candlestick were four cups made like almond-blossoms, the knops thereof, and the flowers thereof;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their knops and their branches were of one piece with it: the whole of it was one beaten work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the lamps thereof, seven, and the snuffers thereof, and the snuffdishes thereof, of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of a talent of pure gold made he it, and all the vessels thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the altar of incense of acacia wood: a cubit was the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, foursquare; and two cubits was the height thereof; the horns thereof were of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he overlaid it with pure gold, the top thereof, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it: and he made unto it a crown of gold round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made for it two golden rings under the crown thereof, upon the two ribs thereof, upon the two sides of it, for places for staves wherewith to bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the staves of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the holy anointing oil, and the pure incense of sweet spices, after the art of the perfumer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the altar of burnt-offering of acacia wood: five cubits was the length thereof, and five cubits the breadth thereof, foursquare; and three cubits the height thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the horns thereof upon the four corners of it; the horns thereof were of one piece with it: and he overlaid it with brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the basins, the flesh-hooks, and the firepans: all the vessels thereof made he of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made for the altar a grating of network of brass, under the ledge round it beneath, reaching halfway up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cast four rings for the four ends of the grating of brass, to be places for the staves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the staves of acacia wood, and overlaid them with brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, wherewith to bear it; he made it hollow with planks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the laver of brass, and the base thereof of brass, of the mirrors of the ministering women that ministered at the door of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the court: for the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, a hundred cubits;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their pillars were twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the north side a hundred cubits, their pillars twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings for the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so for the other side: on this hand and that hand by the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sockets for the pillars were of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver; and the overlaying of their capitals, of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: and twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their pillars were four, and their sockets four, of brass; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the pins of the tabernacle, and of the court round about, were of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the sum of the things for the tabernacle, even the tabernacle of the testimony, as they were counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a skilful workman, and an embroiderer in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and in fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the gold that was used for the work in all the work of the sanctuary, even the gold of the offering, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the silver of them that were numbered of the congregation was a hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred and threescore and fifteen shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a beka a head, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that passed over to them that were numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hundred talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the veil; a hundred sockets for the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the thousand seven hundred seventy and five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, and overlaid their capitals, and made fillets for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the brass of the offering was seventy talents, and two thousand and four hundred shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And therewith he made the sockets to the door of the tent of meeting, and the brazen altar, and the brazen grating for it, and all the vessels of the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets of the gate of the court, and all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made finely wrought garments, for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, the work of the skilful workman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made shoulder-pieces for it, joined together; at the two ends was it joined together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the skilfully woven band, that was upon it, wherewith to gird it on, was of the same piece and like the work thereof; of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they wrought the onyx stones, inclosed in settings of gold, graven with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the breastplate, the work of the skilful workman, like the work of the ephod; of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was foursquare; they made the breastplate double: a span was the length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof, being double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set in it four rows of stones. A row of sardius, topaz, and carbuncle was the first row;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: they were inclosed in inclosings of gold in their settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names; like the engravings of a signet, every one according to his name, for the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made upon the breastplate chains like cords, of wreathen work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made two settings of gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other two ends of the two wreathen chains they put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, in the forepart thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made two rings of gold, and put them upon the two ends of the breastplate, upon the edge thereof, which was toward the side of the ephod inward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulder-pieces of the ephod underneath, in the forepart thereof, close by the coupling thereof, above the skilfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did bind the breastplate by the rings thereof unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be upon the skilfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the hole of the robe in the midst thereof, as the hole of a coat of mail, with a binding round about the hole of it, that it should not be rent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made upon the skirts of the robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the skirts of the robe round about, between the pomegranates;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, upon the skirts of the robe round about, to minister in; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made the coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the mitre of fine linen, and the goodly head-tires of fine linen, and the linen breeches of fine twined linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the girdle of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, the work of the embroiderer; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, like the engravings of a signet, Holy to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they tied unto it a lace of blue, to fasten it upon the mitre above; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus was finished all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting: and the children of Israel did according to all that Jehovah commanded Moses; so did they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought the tabernacle unto Moses, the Tent, and all its furniture, its clasps, its boards, it bars, and its pillars, and it sockets;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the covering of rams’ skins dyed red, and the covering of sealskins, and the veil of the screen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ark of the testimony, and the staves thereof, and the mercy-seat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table, all the vessels thereof, and the showbread;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pure candlestick, the lamps thereof, even the lamps to be set in order, and all the vessels thereof, and the oil for the light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the screen for the door of the Tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the brazen altar, and its grating of brass, its staves, and all its vessels, the laver and its base;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings of the court, its pillars, and its sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court, the cords thereof, and the pins thereof, and all the instruments of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the finely wrought garments for ministering in the holy place, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all that Jehovah commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did all the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saw all the work, and, behold, they had done it; as Jehovah had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the first month shalt thou rear up the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put therein the ark of the testimony, and thou shalt screen the ark with the veil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the things that are upon it; and thou shalt bring in the candlestick, and light the lamps thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt set the golden altar for incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt set the altar of burnt-offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt set the laver between the tent of meeting and the altar, and shalt put water therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt set up the court round about, and hang up the screen of the gate of the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is therein, and shalt hallow it, and all the furniture thereof: and it shall be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt anoint the altar of burnt-offering, and all its vessels, and sanctify the altar: and the altar shall be most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt anoint the laver and its base, and sanctify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the tent of meeting, and shalt wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments; and thou shalt anoint him, and sanctify him, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt bring his sons, and put coats upon them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister unto me in the priest’s office: and their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus did Moses: according to all that Jehovah commanded him, so did he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was reared up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses reared up the tabernacle, and laid its sockets, and set up the boards thereof, and put in the bars thereof, and reared up its pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spread the tent over the tabernacle, and put the covering of the tent above upon it; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the staves on the ark, and put the mercy-seat above upon the ark:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the veil of the screen, and screened the ark of the testimony; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the table in the tent of meeting, upon the side of the tabernacle northward, without the veil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he set the bread in order upon it before Jehovah; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the candlestick in the tent of meeting, over against the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he lighted the lamps before Jehovah; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the golden altar in the tent of meeting before the veil:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he burnt thereon incense of sweet spices; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he set the altar of burnt-offering at the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting, and offered upon it the burnt-offering and the meal-offering; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he set the laver between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water therein, wherewith to wash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet thereat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they went into the tent of meeting, and when they came near unto the altar, they washed; as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he reared up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the screen of the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of Jehovah filled the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was not able to enter into the tent of meeting, because the cloud abode thereon, and the glory of Jehovah filled the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward, throughout all their journeys:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if the cloud was not taken up, then they journeyed not till the day that it was taken up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the cloud of Jehovah was upon the tabernacle by day, and there was fire therein by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator
